abstract.p: Daniel Lee letter responds to July 11 news article about gun death of 5-year-old boy in Kosovo; contends death was not caused by 'accident' but by negligence on part of the person handling the weapon (M)

block.p: Re ''Accident Kills Kosovo Boy'' (news item, July 11):

With a modern military weapon, a truly accidental single discharge is highly unlikely. The chance of an accidental three-round burst is astronomically small. The death of the 5-year-old Kosovo boy was not caused by an ''accident,'' but by negligence on the part of a person handling a powerful firearm.

There are four basic rules of gun safety: Treat all guns as loaded; never point a gun at something you are unwilling to destroy (or always point your weapon in a safe direction); keep your finger off the trigger (and out of the trigger guard) until you are ready to shoot; and be aware of your target and what lies beyond.

In this case, the first three of these rules were definitely not followed.
DANIEL LEE San Mateo, Calif., July 11, 2000
